intro: Swertia tongluensis, commonly known as the Tibetan swertia, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
